items.title: Asian stocks, US treasuries fall on tariff angst
items.description: Asian markets opened lower Tuesday. President Donald Trump's tariff threats regarding Greenland have reignited trade tensions. This has impacted investor confidence. European shares fell significantly on Monday. US markets were closed. Investors are watching for the European Union's response to potential US tariffs. The situation adds to existing market nervousness.

items.title: Stocks in news: ITC Hotels, Tata Capital, Ola Electric, Adani Power, LTIMindtree
items.description: Indian markets opened lower, with the Nifty index falling below a crucial support level. Analysts suggest a continued corrective trend. Despite the overall weakness, some sectors are performing well. Investors are advised to focus on these leading sectors and manage risk.

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 40 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian equity markets closed lower amid a cautious global sentiment and mixed earnings reports. Analysts anticipate sideways trading, influenced by global cues and ongoing corporate results, with geopolitical escalations posing a significant risk. The India VIX saw a 4% rise, indicating increased market fear.

items.title: IndiGo posts biggest single-day gain in 16 months
items.description: IndiGo's parent company, InterGlobe Aviation, saw its shares rise significantly. This surge followed a penalty from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation for flight cancellations. Investors reacted positively as the fine was less than anticipated. The company had faced disruptions in December due to crew time limits and aircraft issues.

items.title: Wipro sinks over 8% as weak Q4 guidance spooks investors
items.description: Wipro shares plummeted over 8% on Monday following a disappointing fourth-quarter growth outlook provided by the IT services firm. The company reported revenue of ₹23,556 crore for the quarter ended December 31, with modest sequential and year-on-year increases. Analysts expressed concern over the management's guidance, leading to a significant drop in the stock price.

items.title: RIL slumps over 3% after Q3 miss dampens growth outlook
items.description: Reliance Industries shares saw a significant drop on Monday. This decline followed the company's third-quarter results. Analysts point to slower growth across its business segments. Investors are advised to observe further developments. The stock has experienced a notable fall in the past month. Technical indicators suggest continued weakness. A cautious approach is recommended for retail investors.

items.title: Sun Pharma places non-binding offer for US-based Organon in its boldest global bet ever
items.description: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd has submitted a non-binding offer to acquire US-based Organon for an all-cash deal, securing $10-14 billion in acquisition financing. This move marks Sun Pharma's boldest global bet, aiming to bolster its presence in women's health biopharma and biosimilars. The acquisition, if successful, would be the largest by an Indian pharmaceutical company.

items.title: Banks feel the pinch as CASA pool shrinks
items.description: As Indian banks grapple with dwindling low-cost CASA deposits, a growing number of savers are shifting their money into market-driven investments seeking higher returns. This shift compels banks to depend increasingly on pricier short-term borrowing methods, such as Certificates of Deposit, to sustain their lending activities.

items.title: Tiger Global saga: An interpretation of maladies that's open to more ills
items.description: Tiger Global may file a review petition following a Supreme Court verdict on the India-Mauritius tax treaty. The ruling alters how investors interpret tax treaties, particularly regarding indirect transfers. This development sparks discussions in tax and legal circles. The verdict's interpretation of a key treaty article differs significantly from investor expectations.

items.title: RBI tightens PSL norms, mandates auditor certification for lenders
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India has strengthened priority sector lending compliance, mandating external auditor certificates from intermediaries to prevent double-claiming of loans. This move follows scrutiny of banks for misclassifying agricultural loans. The RBI aims to ensure credit flows to priority sectors by enhancing monitoring and internal controls.

items.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
items.description: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

items.title: Wipro among 7 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
items.description: As of January 19, seven stocks in the NSE F&O universe saw a notable surge in futures open interest, with total open interest rising by over 10% compared with the previous trading session. A sharp increase in futures open interest indicates a rise in the number of active, unexpired contracts in a security. This trend suggests growing participation, with traders either initiating fresh positions or adding to existing ones in the futures market.

items.title: Selling spree! Dolly Khanna trims stake in 5 stocks, exits one in Q3. Do you own any?
items.description: Ace investor Dolly Khanna has adopted a cautious approach in Q3 FY26, trimming stakes in five stocks and potentially exiting one. She has also added IFB Agro Industries to her portfolio. This move comes amid a generally cautious market sentiment.

items.title: Rs 8,600 crore selloff! Infosys most sold stock by mutual funds in December. Time for a U-turn?
items.description: Mutual funds divested Rs 8,600 crore of Infosys shares in December. The IT major has since reported better-than-expected Q3 results and increased its full-year growth forecast. This performance is now attracting investor attention, signaling a potential stabilization in the stock's outlook. Analysts are revising targets upwards, anticipating accelerated growth driven by AI services.

items.title: PB Fintech among 4 stocks flashing bullish signals, hinting at a possible uptrend
items.description: On January 19, in the Nifty500 pack, four stocks came to the bullish scanner of "White Marubozu", according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets."

items.title: Adani Power in focus as NCLAT clears Rs 4,000-crore Vidarbha Power acquisition
items.description: In terms of valuation, the stock is currently trading at a price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 22.86. Its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio stands at 3.49, while the price-to-book (P/B) ratio is 4.73, indicating how the market values the company relative to its earnings, revenue, and net worth.

items.title: ACME Solar shares in focus as 68 MW Gujarat wind project goes operational
items.description: ACME Solar Holdings announced the commencement of commercial operations for 68 MW of its 100 MW wind power project in Gujarat. Implemented via its subsidiary, the project is backed by a long-term PPA with GUVNL, supporting stable revenues and strengthening ACME’s wind energy portfolio.

items.title: Tata Capital shares gain 2% after Q3 net profit jumps 17% YoY
items.description: Tata Capital shares surged over 2% to Rs 368 after the company reported a strong December quarter performance. Consolidated net profit jumped 17% year-on-year to Rs 1,257 crore, driven by a 12% rise in total revenue to Rs 7,975 crore. Assets under management also saw significant growth.

items.title: Havells India among 4 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On January 19, four stocks from the Nifty200 universe featured in the RSI Trending Up scan, according to data from StockEdge.com. An RSI move above 50 from below is viewed as an uptrend signal, reflecting strengthening momentum and improving sentiment, which traders monitor for possible buying opportunities.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2026: Polycab India, JSW Infra among 5 stocks that could give 20-30% return in long term
items.description: Brokerages remain constructive on select Indian stocks, highlighting a mix of large-cap lenders, infrastructure plays and consumption-driven names as attractive opportunitiesWe have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: LTIMindtree shares tank nearly 7% as Q3 profit falls 11%. What should investors do?
items.description: LTIMindtree shares tumbled nearly 7% after it reported an 11% year-on-year net profit decline in Q3, largely due to a one-time Rs 590 crore charge from new labor codes. Excluding this, adjusted profit rose 29% YoY. Revenue increased 12% YoY to Rs 10,781 crore, with management highlighting a strong performance driven by AI strategy and deal wins.

items.title: Avana Electrosystems shares to list today. Check GMP ahead of debut
items.description: Based on the prevailing GMP, the stock is indicated to list at around Rs 69-70 per share, though grey market trends are unofficial and can change closer to listing.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc shares gain 2% on highest-ever PAT growth in Q3. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: Hindustan Zinc shares rose 2% after it achieved its highest ever quarterly revenue and profit. Mined metal production saw a significant year-on-year increase. The company also reported its lowest cost of production in five years. This strong performance has led to an upgrade by HSBC, with a raised target price. Borrowings have decreased, and net cash has improved.

items.title: Negative Breakout: These 10 stocks cross below their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market cap over Rs 10,000 crore, 10 stocks' closing prices crossed below their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on January 19, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. Trading below the 200 DMA is considered a negative signal because it indicates that the stock's price is below its long-term trend line. The 200 DMA is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. Take a look:"

items.title: Brokerages initiate coverage on Meesho, Groww, Angel One, 8 other stocks this week. How many do you have?
items.description: A host of domestic and global brokerages have initiated coverage on select Indian stocks across sectors such as broking, insurance and hospitality. Analysts are bullish on major names such as Groww, Angel One, Meesho and forecast an upside of up to 51% from current market levels. Here is a list of 11 stocks on which brokerages initiated coverage this week.

items.title: Aditya Birla Fashion shares slide 9% after reports of Rs 289 crore block deal
items.description: Shares of Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail slid to a 52-week low after a Rs 289 crore block deal, as reports pointed to a clean-out trade by an undisclosed institutional investor.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Citi maintains buy on LIC; Goldman Sachs raises target price on Havells India post results
items.description: Brokerage firms remain bullish on select large-cap stocks, with Citi maintaining a buy on LIC, Goldman Sachs raising its target on Havells India, and Motilal Oswal reiterating a buy on PNB, citing improving fundamentals, valuation comfort, and earnings visibility.

items.title: Kotak Mahindra AMC, Aequitas among top 10 equity PMS performers in 2025. Full list here
items.description: Indian equities remained volatile amid sectoral churn in December 2025, with investors favouring selective stock and theme-based strategies. Against this backdrop, 10 equity PMS portfolios stood out based on their performance as of December 2025. The list includes quant, value, thematic and diversified strategies. Here’s how these portfolios are positioned through their top holdings in the current market environment.

items.title: Ola Electric Mobility shares tank 7%, down for 10th consecutive session. What’s triggering the fall today?
items.description: Ola Electric Mobility shares dropped significantly after CFO Harish Abichandani resigned, citing personal reasons. This marks the second executive departure in two months. The company also launched its first residential Battery Energy Storage System, 'Shakti', powered by its indigenous 4680 Bharat Cells, aiming to transform energy access for households and businesses.

items.title: UPL subsidiary Advanta Enterprises files draft IPO papers with Sebi
items.description: UPL’s seed business Advanta Enterprises has filed draft IPO papers with Sebi for a proposed offer for sale, allowing the agrochemicals group and other shareholders to partially monetise their holdings amid an active Indian primary market.

items.title: More pain ahead? Top 10 retail-dominated stocks crash up to 43% as Indian markets underperformed since one year
items.description: Several stocks dominated by retail ownership have delivered negative returns since June 2024, even after strong gains in the earlier rally. According to Kotak Equities, the correction has been sharper in names where the gap between retail and institutional ownership is wide, highlighting how crowded retail trades can unwind quickly when market momentum fades.

items.title: Budget expectations low, says Jefferies; lists defence capex among 8 measures to watch out for
items.description: Jefferies expects limited surprises in the FY27 Union Budget, with the government sticking to fiscal consolidation while focusing on defence-led capex and targeted consumption support. The FY27 fiscal deficit is seen around 4.2% of GDP, though a higher 4.4% could signal a growth push, supporting equities but pressuring bond yields.

items.title: Jindal Saw shares rally 20% in two sessions on strong Q3FY26 results
items.description: Jindal SAW shares climbed nearly 20% in two sessions, hitting an intraday high of Rs 188.38 on Tuesday. This surge followed strong sequential earnings growth in Q3FY26, with profit after tax rising 78% QoQ. The company also reported a robust order book of US$1,481 million and progress in reducing long-term debt, boosting investor confidence.

items.title: PNB shares slide 5% in 2 days after Q3 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: Punjab National Bank shares slid 5% over two sessions after its December-quarter results, as margin contraction and a cut in NIM guidance overshadowed a profit beat and improving asset quality. Brokerages remain divided, with concerns over sustained margin pressure offset by stable credit growth and strong recoveries.

items.title: Budget 2026: How India introduced, scrapped and raised capital gains taxes for stock market investors
items.description: As Budget 2026 approaches, the stock market is demanding tax relief amid persistent foreign investor selling and weak returns. India's equity taxation has evolved significantly, with long-term capital gains tax reintroduced in 2018 and short-term gains recently increased. Market participants hope for policy adjustments to revive inflows and confidence.

items.title: HDFC Bank’s forced balancing act drags stock 6%, makes it Nifty Bank’s biggest laggard. What to do?
items.description: HDFC Bank shares remain under pressure despite in-line Q3 results as deposit concerns and a stretched CD ratio weigh on sentiment. Brokerages stay constructive, citing medium-term growth visibility, valuation comfort, and gradual normalisation of balance sheet metrics.

items.title: Bharat Coking Coal shares rally 4% on Day 2. Should you buy?
items.description: Bharat Coking Coal Ltd shares saw a significant jump after their market debut. The company's initial public offering was heavily oversubscribed, indicating strong investor interest. Experts suggest short-term investors book profits while long-term investors can hold with a stop-loss. BCCL's strategic importance in India's coal sector and future earnings potential are key drivers.

items.title: Eternal Q3 preview: Earnings set to grow 50% YoY; Blinkit losses persist
items.description: Eternal anticipates strong growth in the December quarter. Blinkit's shift to a first-party model and quick commerce are key drivers. Food delivery shows steady demand and improving margins. Blinkit's rapid expansion continues, but losses persist. Hyperpure also sees growth. Analysts will watch competitive intensity and Blinkit's path to profitability.

items.title: Dr Reddy's Q3 preview: PAT may fall 22% YoY as US pressure to weigh on earnings
items.description: Dr Reddy's Laboratories anticipates a subdued performance for the December quarter. Pressure from its United States business is expected to offset steady growth in India and Europe. Analysts predict a decline in revenue and profit after tax. The US market faces challenges from pricing pressure and reduced contribution from gRevlimid.

items.title: Bajaj Electricals shares surge 11%, competitor stocks tumble up to 5%. What’s happening?
items.description: Bajaj Electricals is venturing into the wires segment, boosting its stock by 11%. This strategic move aims to capitalize on rising demand and diversify operations. While existing players like RR Kabel and Havells saw dips, experts highlight the segment's resilience and consistent growth, even with fluctuating copper prices. The company plans a phased investment based on market response.

items.title: Dow futures sink over 600 points; Trump’s Greenland move drags Europe, Asian markets
items.description: Global markets tumbled Tuesday as U.S. futures indicated sharp declines following President Trump's threat of new tariffs on eight European countries. Asian shares mostly fell, with Tokyo's Nikkei down 1.1% amid election speculation and rising bond yields. European markets also opened lower, reflecting concerns over trade tensions and corporate earnings.

items.title: IEX shares fall over 4% ahead of APTEL hearing on market coupling
items.description: IEX shares fell sharply on Tuesday ahead of APTEL’s hearing on the market coupling issue, extending their two-day decline. Investor caution has risen as CERC signalled that market coupling will not proceed until proper regulations are framed, while past orders face uncertainty.

items.title: LG Electronics India shares can rally another 20%, says JM Financial after initiating coverage with Buy. Check target price
items.description: JM Financial has initiated coverage on LG Electronics India with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 1,630, implying a 20% upside. The brokerage cites LG’s market leadership, strong manufacturing base, collaboration with its Korean parent and robust financials, while noting risks from competition, supplier dependence and royalty hikes.

items.title: Stock Market Crash: Sensex plunges 900 points, Nifty slips below 25,300. 5 factors behind today’s market mayhem
items.description: Indian stock markets saw a sharp fall on Tuesday. The Sensex and Nifty dropped to their lowest points in over two months. This decline followed losses in the previous session. Mixed corporate earnings, foreign fund outflows, and global trade uncertainty contributed to the weak sentiment. Information technology stocks led the selloff.

items.title: One simple question solves many problems, including volatility. 6 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with upside potential of up to 34%
items.description: Don’t be surprised by the yo-yo-like movement of the Nifty and Sensex. In fact, get used to it. There is a greater probability that the market’s volatility quotient will remain high for the next couple of months (probably longer) for multiple reasons. But that does not mean that you cannot be bullish and don't invest in stocks. You can, but with a caveat: While buying stocks, focus on risk-management. Now, risk management has two aspects, one related to the price and other related to the business. Which is more important? And at which point of time?

items.title: MFs' Favourite: 13 smallcap stocks surge up to 170% in FY26 so far, 5 turn multibaggers
items.description: As December-quarter shareholding data rolls in for over half the BSE smallcap universe—about 706 companies—a clear trend is emerging. Mutual funds have quietly raised stakes in nearly 205 smallcap stocks since September. The market has already responded: around 80 of these names have logged double-digit gains in FY26.The real standouts are 13 smallcaps that have delivered staggering returns of 70% to 170% in under 10 months—precisely the ones where MFs upped their holdings in Q3 FY26. Notably, five of them have more than doubled investor wealth. It’s a revealing look at where smart money is flowing and which stocks are leading the charge. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: Promoters raise stakes in 10 Nifty 500 stocks in December quarter
items.description: A rise in promoter shareholding typically signals greater confidence from a company’s promoters or key shareholders in its future prospects. In the Nifty 500 index, here are the top 10 stocks where promoters increased their holdings in the December ’25 quarter compared with the September ’25 quarter, according to the StockEdge shareholding scan. The trend shows increase in promoter stake may signal confidence in the company’s prospects, as promoters commit more of their own capital. A rising promoter holding is generally viewed as a positive indicator of management’s outlook and is often considered a bullish signal by investors.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Hindustan Zinc, Ola electric among 6 stocks that moved most on Tuesday
items.description: Indian headline indices ended sharply lower on Tuesday amid tariff and geopolitical concerns, causing widespread sell-off across sectors. It was their second successive fall. While Nifty ended the day at 25,232.50, down 353 points or 1.38%, the BSE Sensex closed at 82,180.47, falling by 1065.71 points or 1.28%. Here are 6 stocks that saw action today:

items.title: Hindustan Zinc and 3 other stocks hit 52-week high; rally up to 16% in a month
items.description: Benchmark Sensex plunged nearly 1,066 points to end at 82,180 on Tuesday. Despite the sharp market sell-off, four stocks from the BSE 500 index touched their 52-week highs, marking their strongest levels in a year. Such breakouts are widely seen by traders and investors as bullish signals, reflecting strong momentum and the possibility of further upside.

items.title: Nomura sued by Adani-linked fund accused in short-seller Hindenburg report
items.description: The Elara-owned Oyster Bay Fund borrowed from Nomura to make leveraged bets on Adani Enterprises and Adani Ports. Those positions collapsed after Hindenburg Research’s January 2023 report accused the Adani Group of “brazen stock manipulation” and suggested Elara-linked funds were involved, according to High Court filings.

items.title: Two Trades for Today: A private sector banking major for a 4.7% gain, a mid-cap cement manufacturing stock for a 6% rise
items.description: Our technical analysts identify select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Here are the technical calls for today.

items.title: Adani Power plans up to Rs 7,500 crore NCD raise
items.description: Adani Power plans to raise Rs 7,500 crore via non-convertible debentures, targeting institutional investors to refinance debt and fund operations. The company operates 18 gigawatts of thermal capacity and aims to expand to 42 gigawatts by 2032.

items.title: Tata Motors (CV) block deal: BNP Paribas picks up Rs 152 crore stake as Goldman Sachs sells
items.description: BNP Paribas acquired 35.43 lakh Tata Motors Commercial Vehicle shares via a Rs 152 crore block deal from Goldman Sachs. Shares slipped post-deal, while the company reported a quarterly loss despite revenue growth and margin improvement.
